result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon G Esty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Abduction of Child-Taking [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.30(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
-AODA & any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  No bars or taverns
-No contact with any of the victims - ELI or DSS or their families.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

CONFIDENTIAL DOCUMENT
of hearing held on September 8, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
1:11 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with one corrections,  and no additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision

CONDITIONS:

-AODA & any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.No bars or taverns
-No contact with any of the victims - ELI or DSS or their families.
-Court costs
-Restitution - $769.59 Joint & Several
-Extradition Costs - $1,187.00
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court grants the defendant 217 days of jail credit.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAR programs.

Court adjourned at 11:25 a.m.
to counsel with a copy of the Presentence Investigation Report
Sentencing hearing at 09-08-2015 11:00 am

3:05 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - upon plea to count 1 as PTAC and no repeater, counts 2,3 & 4 will be dismiss and read-in and parties will request a presentence investigation.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as PTAC.  Court strikes the repeater.  Court orders counts 2,3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a Presentence Investigation report be completed and filed with the court in 60 days.  Court sets for sentencing on September 8, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:11 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-22-2015 03:00 pm

2:40 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christensonfor the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and needs to run it past the defendant.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on June 22, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:41 p.m.
Summary of Restitution w/attachments - $796.59
State's
Defendant's
for Discovery (Defendant's)
Status hearing at 06-15-2015 02:00 pm

3:42 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court will set for Status Hearing on June 15, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:44 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
Status hearing at 04-20-2015 03:00 pm

1:14 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs to do evaluation paperwork.  Court sets for Status Hearing on April 20, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.

NO Contact with DSS and ELI.  NO Contact with Nathan F.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Charlene at GLSO.
43
Status hearing at 03-16-2015 01:00 pm

NO Contact with DSS and ELI.  NO Contact with Nathan F.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5,000.00 cash bond and conditions of: NO Contact with DSS and ELI.  NO Contact with Nathan F.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
